intro: Psilochenia runcinata subsp. hallii, commonly known as the Hall's narrowleaf psilochenia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces umbellate inflorescences with small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is native to specific regions in North America, particularly in the southwestern United States. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
